title: What if Yasuo windwall costed flow to cast?
body:
#Yasuo Change Ideas:

>Idea 1: 

>Yasuo can cast Windwall as long as he has some sort of amount of flow but the duration depends on how much flow Yasuo had upon casting the ability.

***
#Or
***

>Idea 2: 

>Removed - INTENT: Yasuo gains double the critical strike chance from all sources but his basic attacks and Steel Tempest Steel Tempest respectively deal 90% and 75% damage when Critical strike icon critically striking.

>E: Sweeping Blade

>NEW Passive: Yasuo gains 10% Critical Strike chance per cast of this ability for 5 seconds.

>Max gain: 50%

***
#Or
***

>Idea 3:

>W: Wind wall

>NEW: No longer blocks ultimate abilities.

Or

Costs 100 Flow to cast, so it makes Yasuo decide between his shield or the wall.
I mean, it's not like he gets full Flow when he ults or anything to get the shield back mid-fight, oh wait.....
Hmmm

I like the idea. 
It makes Yasuo have to actually be smart.

It's stupidly easy to remove his shield.
There's nothing "smart" about it, against a decent opponent the shield has 0 uptime aka it's popped the moment it recharges.

> [{quoted}](name=Sraeg2013,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WWsXv3J3,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2017-10-30T00:00:11.400+0000)

> There's nothing "smart" about it, against a decent opponent the shield has 0 uptime aka it's popped the moment it recharges.

The shield lasts several seconds in effect once it's 'popped', it doesn't just do a flash and then disappear into the abyss, you know. So the uptime can be reduced, but it obviously can never be 0, especially not when it also recharges so fast while we're at it.

Several seconds?

The shield last exactly 1 (ONE, UNO, ICHI, EINS) second unless it tanks enough damage to break sooner and begins with a 17 seconds recharge time assuming constant dashing and scales down to about 10 seconds with levels, movement speed and points in Sweeping Dash.

Nearly every champion with a shield can shield themselves way more often (10 seconds at rank 1 being the most common), do it on demand and for way longer.

> [{quoted}](name=Sraeg2013,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WWsXv3J3,comment-id=000100000000000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-30T19:44:37.408+0000)

> 
> The shield last exactly 1 (ONE, UNO, ICHI, EINS) second unless it tanks enough damage to break sooner and begins with a 17 seconds recharge time assuming constant dashing and scales down to about 10 seconds with levels, movement speed and points in Sweeping Dash.
> 
> Nearly every champion with a shield can shield themselves way more often (10 seconds at rank 1 being the most common), do it on demand and for way longer.

I was wrong to say that it lasts "several" seconds.

But you're also wrong in completely ignoring that Yasuo's shield is on top of his lane mobility, multi-stage ranged pokes, resoureceless-ness so his entire kit doesn't have any resource cost, the low CD across the board, and another windwall that blocks all projectiles.

So no, it's not easy to just remove his shield, because that mechanic itself is already an overkill on a champ who has minuscule amount of windows to have a shot at interacting with them without getting negated or bullied back somehow, no matter which type of champ you are (melee can ignore the windwall but most can't deal with his supreme lane mobility and the fact he's both resourcelss and function on almost no CD; ranged then have it worse).

When you consider all of the above factors, yes, a free shield every 10 or so seconds is too much (let's face it, Yasuo doesn't need 17 seconds to recharge the shield; in higher levels, Yasuo is fully capable of using shield more than once in the middle of a long teamfight without ulti).

>But you're also wrong in completely ignoring that Yasuo's shield is on top of his lane mobility, multi-stage ranged pokes, resoureceless-ness so his entire kit doesn't have any resource cost, the low CD across the board, and another windwall that blocks all projectiles.

It requires a single basic attack to access his low base stats.
Outside his 3rd Q he has next to no ranged capabilities.
Resourcelessness while possibly frustrating is still more balanced than the one of the likes of Katarina whom everybody is adamant is a great and healthy champion.
And Windwall requires... stepping to the side, disengaging or pressing the advantage.

>So no, it's not easy to just remove his shield, because that mechanic itself is already an overkill on a champ who has minuscule amount of windows to have a shot at interacting with them without getting negated or bullied back somehow, no matter which type of champ you are (melee can ignore the windwall but most can't deal with his supreme lane mobility and the fact he's both resourcelss and function on almost no CD; ranged then have it worse).

No, those things are unrelated.
It literally requires a basic attack of any strength to make his shield a non-factor.
Ranged champions have a stupidly easy time removing his shield, unless he blocks the attempt with a Windwall and which point he loses twice at the same time.

>When you consider all of the above factors, yes, a free shield every 10 or so seconds is too much (let's face it, Yasuo doesn't need 17 seconds to recharge the shield; in higher levels, Yasuo is fully capable of using shield more than once in the middle of a long teamfight without ulti).

If you'd bother reading my comment instead of producing this mini wall'o'text, you'd know I said it STARTS with a 17 second cooldown and GOES DOWN to about 10 seconds later.

> [{quoted}](name=Sraeg2013,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WWsXv3J3,comment-id=00010000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-30T20:42:17.960+0000)
>
> It requires a single basic attack to access his low base stats.
> Outside his 3rd Q he has next to no ranged capabilities.
> Resourcelessness while possibly frustrating is still more balanced than the one of the likes of Katarina whom everybody is adamant is a great and healthy champion.
> And Windwall requires... stepping to the side, disengaging or pressing the advantage.

Nice list of conveniently forgotten things.

* You forgot that the shield lasts 1 second after being triggered.
* You forgot that he has immense mobility in lane to jump in and out of fight and reposition for both low range and high range Q.
* You forgot that Katarina has comparatively much higher CD than Yasuo without triggering the conditional refresh that is gated behind a specific kind of takedowns. And that's saying something because you know, it's fucking Kat we're comparing him to?
* You forgot that windwall has a fucking surface area, cast from Yasuo himself (hence most popularly used to "block" a spell that's ALREADY hit) so likely it has already blocked whatever critical spells you were just throwing at him, lingers around after being cast for some time, is omnidirectional, has a big ass hitbox, and all of the factors above that also play into the strength of the windwall with the sole exclusion of its CD which is the only saving grace from having Yasuo being completely broken.

> No, those things are unrelated.
> It literally requires a basic attack of any strength to make his shield a non-factor.
> Ranged champions have a stupidly easy time removing his shield, unless he blocks the attempt with a Windwall and which point he loses twice at the same time.

You talk as if Yasuo is just a champ who nothing in his kit but a periodic shield. Read the above.

> If you'd bother reading my comment instead of producing this mini wall'o'text, you'd know I said it STARTS with a 17 second cooldown and GOES DOWN to about 10 seconds later.

No, maybe you should read. Because all it says is that (background knowledge Yasuo's passive does not have a CD) you do not need 17 seconds to recharge it in low levels, and in high levels it doesn't need 10. It's more like 10 seconds in low levels, and whatever low number it is in high levels, as Yasuo is entirely able to regen his shield within the same teamfight without ulti in late game.

.............

Again, the point isn't that shield is exclusively the problem, but rather a combination of all of his kit designs makes him utterly obnoxious with minuscule size of meaningful countering window for his opponents. The shield is just the icing on the cake and by far the easiest to target and address without simply remaking the damn champion from the ground up.

I'm kinda glad that someone actually thinks about it instead of just simply saying yes that it's a bad idea.

Thanks for the opinion dude, appreciated.

In the first place, he's not even strong Mid Lane right now, he's [succeeding in Top Lane](https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Yasuo/Top/); many of his favorable matchups not even being dependant on one hit wonder projectiles. Also, he's weak. That's a fact. If you're going to gut his defenses this badly he MUST receive some sort of compensation. Are we just going to raise his base damages to the point he becomes an obnoxious Bruiser _again_, or are you going to spike his scaling so he becomes ridiculously feast or famine? Or are you just going to increase his base defensive stats, ultimately defeating the purpose of this change?

This is a short sighted solution that only barely solves a short sighted problem.

On paper, this might sound like a good idea, but if you actually look at what this change would do it makes zero sense.

What this change does is it completely removes one of Yasuo's defensive tools. With 0 compensation.

Yasuo might be irritating to lane against, but he is NOT overpowered right now. This change would dumpster him, easily bring him to the lowest win rate in the entire game.  (har har, I hate Yasuo he should be dumpster,).

On top of that, it removes control of his own kit. He no longer gets to control his abilities because simply doing what is required against Yasuo (harassing one in a while with an AA), completely deletes his Windwall from his kit.

His entire system of Flow would have to be completely reworked. Because with the current system he has no control over sitting at 100 Flow if he wants to to maintain the potential for a full powered Windwall.

Tbh I don't think having Yasuo go down would be a bad idea, don't get me wrong I don't want it to happen because I know the frustration when your favourite champion is not in the best state but so what? We are long gone from Yasuo being a strong pick at a pro level. 

Just because champions exist that are in a bad state (Ryze is questionable, but whatever), does not mean you should just dumpster another champion that is fine right now (sitting at 50% win rate top, and 49% win rate mid).

For fucks sake, Yasuo isnt even being played mid anymore. His most common role right now is top. And all this change would do is dumpster his midlane even more.
